name: Baby Cheeks Lip + Cheek Cream Blush Stick
about: What it is:¬†A healthy flush of clean color in just one swipe. The creamy, blendable formula melds with skin for a hydrating, natural finish...Coverage:¬†Medium..Finish: Natural..Formulation:¬†Stick..Highlighted Ingredients:.- Berryflux Vita: Boosts hydration and helps preserve youthful-looking skin..- Jojoba Seed Oil: Improves hydration and strengthens skin's moisture barrier..- Vitus Vita Fruit Extract: Firms, boosts moisture, helps to detoxify...Ingredient Callouts: This product is gluten-free and cruelty-free and vegan...What Else You Need to Know:¬†The multi-use formula for cheeks and lips is infused with hydrating ingredients for a flushed-from-within pop of color. Biomimicry pigment technology boosts pigment payoff and makes layering over liquid or powder formulas effortless. Mix and match these ultra flattering shades to your mood...CLEAN at Sephora is our commitment to offering formulas that go beyond regulatory standards to avoid controversial ingredients without sacrificing on effectiveness.
ingredients: -Berryflux Vita: Hydration boosting and youth-preserving properties. .-Organic Jojoba Seed Oil: Improves hydration and strengthens skin‚Äôs moisture barrier. .-Vitus Vita Fruit Extract: Visibly firms, boosts moisture, helps to detoxify...Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride Kaolin Caprylyl Caprylate/Caprate Simmondsia Chinensis (Jojoba) Seed Oil Polyethylene Mica Polyhydroxystearic Acid Lecithin Behenylcarbamoylpropyl Polysilsesquioxane Tocopherol Ascorbyl Palmitate Citric Acid Rubus Idaeus Leaf Cell Culture May Contain: Titanium Dioxide Ci 77891 Iron Oxides Ci 77491 Iron Oxides Ci 77492 Iron Oxides Ci 77499 Red 30 Lake Ci 73360 Blue 1 Lake Ci 42090 Red 7 Lake Ci 15850 Yellow 5 Lake Ci 19140...The list of ingredients is subject to change. Please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.Gucci Westman's Tip:.-Use Westman Atelier Baby Blender Brush (sold separately) to blend blush onto the cheeks..-Work in a small oval motion, blending up and outward as you go....For Cheeks: Apply the stick directly to the skin or dab Baby Cheeks onto Westman Atelier Baby Blender Brush (sold separately) or fingers. Gently blend onto the middle of your cheekbone....For Lips: Pop onto lips directly for fullness and juiciness.

reviews.review_title: read if ur pale! & not worth the $ for most ppl
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: this blush has gotten so much hype, so i was honestly shocked that i didn‚Äôt fall in love with it. my main issue is to do with the shade, which is very subjective, so ill first explain what i think of the performance and formula. it is pretty matte, which personally didn‚Äôt sit very nicely on my skin, but it may work better if your skin is not dry. i will note that i have never had this issue with other  matte cream blushes (i actually typically prefer them). however, it is long lasting because it is so matte. it blends out well and has a very nice level of pigment, so it is very user-friendly. it has a LOT of very large gold shimmer particles (that are not shown or mentioned ANYWHERE in the product images or product descriptions). i found the shimmer to be so glittery and chunky that it accentuated texture on my skin.   i decided to purchase this because they launched a limited edition shade (coquette) described by sephora as a ‚Äúcool soft pink‚Äù and described by WA as a ‚Äúpeachy pink.‚Äù I have very fair skin, and so i was happy to see this shade because the others are too dark for me. they don‚Äôt have WA at my local sephora, so i ordered this online. when i received it, the blush looked way more warm toned and peachy than i expected, but it still looked like a promising shade. i was SHOCKED to see that when i blended it out on my skin it went from light peachy pink to a true orange with a hint of pink. i tried to just not blend it very much to prevent it from turning orange, but it stays way too intense and pigmented if i don‚Äôt actually blend it out a normal amount. it is way too orange to suit my skin tone, so i will have to return it because i will never be able to use it. i would have kept it despite not liking the formula if the shade was usable for me, but sadly it would just collect dust if i kept it.   If you have a truly pale skin tone, i highly suggest not buying this blush, specifically shade coquette. i can see how some people would like this blush if they fo

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The color coquette is beautiful--I don't know why it is limited edition. I am not a fan of clean beauty, and I had purchased this in another color (petal) that ended up being warmer than expected, so I returned it. This is a beautiful, sophisticated formula and a beautiful color for fair, cool/neutral skin. I love the luxe magnetic packaging, and the color payoff is actually nice and buildable. It is not greasy at all, and it can be applied directly to the skin and blended out with my fingers. The only issue I have is that I have so much makeup that I'm afraid this will go bad before I finish it, and with it being a limited edition color, I can't even replace it, should I want to. This is the only color that appeals to me in the line, unfortunately. I think the people who say theirs smelled bad are right, such is the issue with clean beauty preservative systems, and I only got this because it was new stock. Mine smells fine (for now) - hopefully it stays that way for a while!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I've generally been a bit afraid of makeup as it all seemed to be so full of pore-clogging ingredients, and aside from covering up blemishes it just didn't seem worth the risk...that is until I discovered brands like Westman Atelier that combine makeup and skincare! I love it!   I've only tried the shade petal so far, and it's just the most perfect natural looking flush that would work on most skin tones. It's just the right level of pigmented - not so pigmented that it's difficult to blend, and pigmented enough to have noticeable colour. It blends like a dream and has a very beautiful, natural looking satin finish. Not matte, but not shiny either.  Granted I haven't been wearing it every day, but I don't think this product has bothered my skin at all or broken me out. The packaging is also super nice and has a really luxe feel to it - it's heavy, and the magnetic lid is a nice touch. My one gripe is the price - it's just a lot of money for the amount of product. Is it SO much better than any other cream blush that you must absolutely pay the price for this one? No, it's definitely a luxury purchase. I'm not sure if I'll repurchase or not. I do really like that it's skincare oriented blush (which most aren't) and done well, but it is worth the premium for that? Idk.

reviews.review_title: Love it, but ONLY the shade Poppet!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm almost mad at how much I like this! Do I want to own and love a $48 blush? Absolutely not. But here we are! I am obsessed with the shade Poppet so much but I doubt I'll try other shades. The pigmentation and uniqueness of the color are part of why I love it, but some of the more neutral colors don't feel like they would be worth it to me. Here's why: I was honestly having buyer's remorse about purchasing such an expensive blush, not really intending to use it also as a lippie, since rarely do these types of 2-in-1 products actually work out the way I think they will. Usually, the color and/or consistency are great on one, and bad on the other. I also wasn't expecting the consistency to be something that actually stayed on long enough to wear on my lips. Well, here we are, with me loving a product that I'm still mad about the price of :)  This shade is *gorgeous* on my cheeks and lips and stays on my lips WAY longer than I thought it would. Something so creamy usually flies right off my lips the second I take a sip of coffee, but this stuff sticks around! It doesn't have the staying power of, like a true matte lipstick, but I didn't expect it to and that's not how it's marketed. I'm more shocked at how well it leaves a little blur or color, well after it should have come off. Here's where the cost/shade becomes really important for me - because the shade adds a nice wash of color to my lips and I just don't think any of the shades would show up very well. If I want to use it as both lip/cheek, it has to be a brighter shade. Anything more neutral would just only show up on my cheeks and its wayyyyy to expensive to just be a blush. If It didn't stay as well on my lips, I'd be returning. Bonus points for the magnetic lid (why don't we have more of those!?!) but minus one star for the amount of product - the tube can (and should) hold way more, given the price and honestly it feels rude to charge that much for such a small amount when the tube holds double.

I have very fair, cool-toned skin and am usually the second palest color in most foundations.  Petal oxidized on me and took on a peach tone..  I also had to use a lot to get any color payoff.  I'll try Poppet.  If you are fair like me, do not assume that a paler color will be the right choice.  It's only the right choice if you want a barely-there kind of look, which if you have more natural color than me might work fine.  On me, petal made me look like a vampire. Color aside, I thought this seemed slightly patchy on my combo skin. I'll try the color Poppet and see if I do better with that.  I like the ease of the stick, so debating if I can make this work for me with a different brush.

I find it pretty long lasting even without setting with loose powder or a powder blush, but setting it does make it last even longer. I just can't imagine a more perfect cream blush, but I wish the price tag wasn't so hard to swallow. That said, I know I'll have the other shades in my collection before long.

reviews.review_text: I get that this blush seems crazy expensive. And it's true for many of us it's unaffordable. But if you find yourself with an extra $50 to burn it IS worth it. I have maturing dry skin (40yo female) and powder blushes always look so dry on my skin and are unwearable in the winter. Cream blushes look great but they do not last for more than 30 minutes. It's crazy. This blush is so highly pigmented and it lasts ALL DAY. All. Day. I haven't used one single other blush since I bought this and while other reviews say there isn't much product I can tell that even with daily use this stick will last me a year. Full disclosure I won't be using it as a lip product, only blush. If you buy it I highly recommend using a fluffier blush brush. I tired a fuller slanted brush and even being light handed it came out too strong. The fluffy brush looks perfect for a natural blush look.

My mom loves it so much I got her Dou Dou (heeheehee) as part of Christmas. I want to get Petal for myself during the next sale. I do think it's worth the splurge and age inclusive-would look beautiful on a 20 year old and a 70+ year old.

reviews.review_text: As with Atelier's entire line, the packaging is gorgeous and substantial. The color options are appealing, but the color I have--Petal--described a dusky rose nude of sorts, runs a bit warm for me in person.  Because I don't use setting powder and use a BB cushion and very glow-promoting base products, it's difficult for me to wear blush in general. Though I've found that some blush tints can work over my cushion foundation without removing product, they usually don't last long. (I have yet to go for powder blush, which would be the logical solution, because I find using powder anywhere besides my eye area to prevent smudging does not bode well for my dry skin.)  Anyway, though this blush stick did not remove my foundation, I wasn't a huge fan of the way it played with it. Additionally, the color was a bit to warm for me. The formula seems creamy and nice, and I think this would be well-suited for those who don't use bb cream. I will try this again on a bare skin day, or if I wear actual foundation. Otherwise, I'm sure my sister would be thrilled to be gifted this!  Three stars, mostly because this isn't suitable for me!

reviews.review_title: Poppet and Minette are not the same formula.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I bought the shade Minette at launch and I still love that blush. There is still so much product left even after using it a ton. I think it'll go bad before I get through the whole stick. I bought Poppet about two weeks ago and I can't believe how much better it is than Minette. I understand some of the reviews I've read about this blush now. If each color is vastly different, then maybe some are terrible and some are amazing. Poppet is amazing. Minette is really good but not as good as Poppet.   Poppet is much creamier and the pigment is a lot more saturated than Minette. I've used it 5-6 times since I got it. I tried layering it with a blush from Menagerie cosmetics (Agarita) and together they lasted about ten hours on my face. Poppet lasts about 6 hours on its own before I see noticeable fading. I think it looks really natural on me, not like I'm wearing a ton of blush. At the same time it gives me enough of a flush where I feel like I'm made up. I included a photo of me wearing Poppet. This photo was taken about an hour after application and I used Poppet with all cream products and a very light dusting of powder. I have light/cool/olive skin, which is why this blush doesn't look as bright on me.   I definitely recommend Poppet and Minette but you should definitely read the color-specific reviews for the colors you are interested in since some of them differ!
SUCH a pretty color and applies like a dream, but as other reviews have mentioned it doesn‚Äôt last all day. I had to return for that reason.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Like another reviewer mentioned, the longevity is not great, the packaging is not recyclable and it can‚Äôt be refilled (at least to my knowledge) and it turns very fast. I had mine for less than a year and it started smelling rancid as well as getting these weird spots/changes in texture. Overall just way to expensive in order to have to dispose of it so quickly AND have to just throw out that gorgeous packaging. The two stars are one for the packaging and one for the shade which was very pretty.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I am absolutely blown away by this blush! I purchased in three shades: Petal, Dou Dou, and Chouchette and I definitely want to purchase in other shades! They apply so seamlessly and show up well on my medium tan skin. Its buildable and doesn‚Äôt pull at my foundation like some cream blushes. I also purchased the contour stick and it just pairs very nicely with all of the colors. Very impressed, definitely one of the best cream blushes I‚Äôve tried!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Okay this product is amazing! The packaging is beautiful and sturdy and the color payoff of minette is such a wonderful peachy pink. I usually pick a more traditional pink blush color but this was a great change up.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Maybe I'm new to CLEAN lux beauty, but I don't think it's for me.  I had to use so much of this product to get any colour pay off.  I literally dabbed it from the tube onto my cheeks and then gently blended the edges with my fingers.  There is a nice glow from the glitter which i like.  I'm medium to light Asian skin tone and have very dry skin.  The colour only lasted 45 min!! The smell reminded me of rancid grease (probably bc it's all natural).  My fav cream blush is Bobbie Browns coral which i think is discontinued.  If I had to choose between this or Milani cream blush, Milani wins hands down.  Milani has no rancid smell and the colour lasts longer.  If i was to keep this, I would end up going through a stick a month and then tossing out this massive plastic and metal tube which is not recyclable. for clean make up... i find this an oxymoron and you will have to use a lot of product to get any colour therefore going through many tubes of this product vs Milani or bobbi brown.  i want to try Fenty since i hear it has good colour pay off.  Save your money!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: A bit darker than what's in the photo, but still a good match for fair skin with pink undertones. Blends well with a blush or fingers.

reviews.review_buyer_description: blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I was really excited to buy this product but I wish I had saved my money -- there are far better and more affordable products out there. Sure, the packaging and the formula are luxurious, but after shelling out nearly $50 I want it to, you know, DO something -- and that means color that stays. This blush doesn't even survive BLENDING. It just disappears. Sephora -- look out, this one's coming back to you.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love this blush. The packaging feels heavy and luxurious. The blush itself is nicely pigmented and easy to blend and looks natural. The feel is moisturizing but not tacky. Good staying power for what it is. Took a star off for being too pricy even with the 20% off.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I was ~influenced~ to buy this blush and I‚Äôm so glad I did (in Poppet and Bichette). It‚Äôs the creamiest formula and just blends into your skin so easily. This blush provides the perfect amount of color for a ‚Äúno makeup makeup‚Äù look. It really doesn‚Äôt even look like you‚Äôre wearing blush at all but rather that you just have a healthy flush. Normally I go for more red/terracotta colors because of my Olive/medium coloring but I decided to try Poppet based on some YouTube reviews and I have to say it‚Äôs gorgeous on my skin. I thought the vibrant pink would be too bold but it creates such a natural, healthy look and is a more realistic color for if I were actually blushing. Bichette is simply beautiful too. I can see myself reaching for this product (both colors) for days when I‚Äôm not wearing any makeup but need some color (cheeks and/or lips), or for no makeup makeup looks (I never really do heavy or full coverage makeup). Overall, glad I purchased this blush and look forward to using it more and more. Now I‚Äôm tempted to branch out to other products from this brand (although my wallet will not be a fan).

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was thinking I could use this for the colder months because of the formula, but it pulled my foundation up, I had to put more foundation on and set lightly with a loose powder, then applied more blush, other than that, I‚Äôve compared it to Bobbi Brown and Tarte cream blushes, I actually like Tarte the best.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I usually don't write reviews for things because I think it's usually unnecessary, but I had to write one for this blush. I never thought I'd spend more than $10 on one, but this one is DEFINITELY worth every penny. It's so pigmented that you only need three dabs per cheek, depending on how heavy your hand is. I've had mine for almost a year and I'm not even a quarter of the way through it yet. The color itself is so beautiful on the skin and warms your face up. I highly recommend.

reviews.review_title: Poppet is worth the price tag
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: First, I use and love a lot of blush sticks and/or cream blushes. I've always wanted to try this one, but the combo of price + so so reviews scared me away. Let me just tell you: After wearing it for the first time, I pretty much ran here to add a positive review because I love this product so much and cannot understand why it isn't rated higher.   I bought the color Poppet, which is the bright pink. I'm about as pale as pale can be with neutral undertones, so I was nervous it might be too overpowering - not so. Poppet leaves the most beautiful healthy looking pink flush, somewhat reminiscent of Bobbi Brown's pale pink powder (which also looks shockingly pink in the pan) I used to use years ago. I think this color could probably flatter any skin tone. I used just one tiny stroke on each cheek, then blended it in easily with my fingers. It is pricey, for sure, but given how little I had to use for one application, I image it will last a long time.  And speaking of price... This stuff feels expensive. Maybe that doesn't matter to some, but if I'm paying for a luxury item, I want it to feel like one. The packaging in weighty and the cap goes on with a satisfying magnetic clasp. Baby Cheeks makes my morning a little more no fuss, but it also makes me feel fancy while using it. Highly recommend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is pretty good. I love the color and that it blends in to the skin pretty naturally. I do think it wears off a bit quickly and you need to use a lot of it to get real color, but its definitely a nice natural looking blush

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Dou dou is one of the first blushes I REALLY fell in love with. I‚Äôve tried the petal shade but this one is really just so special. Dou dou is a shade that goes with almost any look and can really pull your face together. These also last a really long time and mine hasn‚Äôt dried out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is my third blush stick. I love them! They're super pigmented, blend exceptionally well, and don't make me break out.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: These are so pigmented!! They blend so well w your finger or a sponge or WA blush brush. I highly recommend these as I have all but one of them. Nice staying power.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Wow, now these are probably the nicest cream blushes I have ever used.  They do not need any warmup on the skin, you can just immediately apply and it doesn't move the makeup underneath.  It doesn't feel heavy or tacky either and blends like a dream and is buildable too!  It's just so easy to use. The packaging is amazing too with a nice heavy weight to it and a strong magnetic lid to it as well.  I highly recommend this blush stick!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Incredibly expensive but it is the best blush I have ever bought...If you can justify the splurge it truly is a beautiful product. Blends so nice...it blows me away every time I use it. At least as much as a blush can.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This product truly has a transformative effect. What a difference! I never appreciated blush before now. Highly recommend. And very easy to apply.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Loved it so much I purchased four other colors. I have Chouchette- a lovely neutral pink-peach(my favorite), Petal a sweet pink/lavender blush, Minette a peach-coral ish color with shimmer (my least favorite) and Poppy bright berry pink (perfect flush for me). They blend out amazingly. Wear time is about 6-8ish hours for me. Packaging is super sheek and easy to carry around with you for touch ups!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I own both Chouchette and Petal, and they have beautiful color payoff, while still looking natural. These blend so beautifully and easily and give you a beautiful natural looking flush. They are almost effortless to use (as are all WA products I've tried), which makes them my everyday go-to.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love westman atelier blush sticks. This is such a natural color and i feel like it would look great on multiple skin types. It blends in super easy too.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love all of these products as they have great pigmentation and are easy to apply. Minette is my favorite in the summer with a little Poppet and I lean towards Petal in the cooler months. A little goes a long way. I've had my products for a long time and still much left. People always compliment my skin and I do believe WA products give that natural beauty glow.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Great color payoff! I have this in Minette and Petal and I love them both. They have a beautiful sheen to them without looking sweaty or sticky. I would recommend using a stippling brush or fingers for application because using a sponge does sheer these out a lot. Also, these last all day on my combo skin and in the southern heat and humidity.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Not worth the price. You get BARELY any product. You can find better. It‚Äôs a good product but not worth it!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have also tried ilia and merit because they are also clean but they do not have enough pigment. I have this and poppet and they are lovely and have pigment without having to load it on and there is no greasy residue. It‚Äôs more expensive but worth the color and ingredient payoff.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This really is the best blush product I have used. I received a sample and was blown away by how well it blended. Very not psyched about the price, but it is on another level to similar products. I previously used glossier blush and then tower 28 blush. Both were easy to use but darker in the packaging and less pigmented so blending is achieved by really spreading out the product, which subsequently leaves lighter patches if your technique isn't perfect. Upon switching to westman atelier the difference is huge. It is very pigmented and does not pull off the cheek when you blend it around. It's effortless and takes less than a minute to apply to perfectly flushed results. If you're like me, and desire the simplest and most effective makeup routine possible, this product is a winner!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I absolutely love Petal for my very fair, cool, 40yo skin. Makes me look alive and well, not like I have makeup on. If I add to lips it‚Äôs gorgeous. The packaging is sophisticated and the amount of product will last forever. If you want to save money and still go green with a similar shades do formula, I also love Kosas!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, Tan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: As a blush, this product's too dry and stiff a texture to finger-blend, even after warming product up on the back of my hand. It requires a brush. It blends poorly: I get patchy coverage regardless of the brush I use (goat hair or synthetic; pom-pom, flat, round, or angled), the amount of product I apply, or my application technique. I rarely have this problem with blush‚Äîcream, powder, or liquid‚Äîso I‚Äôm confused by this one. I love the Poppet color, but it fades away 90% within 4 hours of wear. No point reapplying it since it‚Äôll look patchy anyway. I‚Äôve used too many better cream/stick blushes to let Westman Atelier slide in this category, especially at their price point.   I haven't tried using this product on my lips because the color probably wouldn't last an hour there, and it'd feel too drying. I'm giving this product 2 stars for the lovely (though short-lived) color and the fact that it didn't cause a bad skin reaction. But I'm surprised by how badly this blush performs.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This whole line is amazing. I love luxe makeup but am admittedly not the most skilled with my application. Gucci's products are absolutely foolproof and are a joy to use - this blush stick is no different. It applies like a dream, blends effortlessly, and lasts all day. The color petal is really nice on my fair skin. If you prefer a really impactful blush this may not be for you as while it is somewhat buildable, it isn't super opaque. It doesn't upset my sensitive skin and leaves me looking glowy. Can't recommend this enough!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is definitely the most high end makeup I own, but I may have to start getting more Westman Atelier products. I just draw on my cheekbones and then rub it in with my hands. It blends effortlessly and gives me a perfect natural looking blush. I love this product and have gotten several friends to try it as well. I also think that it will last a while!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I have all of these except Chouchette and Minette.  My skin is light olive /neutral, very dark eyes, dark hair. I love these as blushes and quick lip color. My favorites are Dou Dou and Poppy.  Petal is nice but not wow (for me, it didn't add anything to my collection b/c I already have nude pink blushes).  Bichette is warmer, more rust (still a brick red color) than it appears in the photo and swatches.  Poppy is intimidating but blends beautifully and brightens the face.  I like applying these with the Westman Atelier baby cheeks blush, or the Zoeva 110 face brush.  Works well with fingers, too.  The only thing I don't like about this is the packaging. I wish it was a smaller diameter to make it easier to carry and store - the grey tube seems so fact when compared to the stick of blush. The other thing I don't like is that magnetic closure....if you only have one Westman Atelier cheek or face product, I'm sure it is fine...but if you have several products, the magnets will repel each other, so they need to be a few inches apart on top of your vanity.   I also have some of the Merit blushes and I know people are curious about how they compare to the WA blush stick.  The Merit blushes are packaged such that they are smaller and lighter so that's a plus.  I do like the dark berry/red in the Merit line better than Bichette and I think the Merit blushes feel lighter on my skin and they blend out more easily and sheerly.  I have to be much more intentional with the WA and application takes longer.  For the foundation stick, my preference is Merit...but for the blushes, I like all of the above!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I bought this blush stick in Poppet after discovering a newfound love for cream blushes. I love the color and texture - creamy, build able, and seems to stay put for a full day of zoom meetings (even on my oily T zone!) I would say I found the texture pretty similar to the Fenty beauty cream blush, but this one is easier to apply (just a few dabs on the cheek) and seems to offer more product. The packaging feels more sturdy as well. All in all, I‚Äôm impressed with the product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Best blush, ever. Super blendable, very natural finish, and pigmentation is definitely there, but just enough so it‚Äôs easy to manage without accidentally putting too much. Lasts on my oil slick skin. Ive only tried petal, but  thinking to purchase some more. This one has no shimmer or glitter, just looks perfectly natural.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Warning, minette is SPARKLY. Didn‚Äôt think that‚Äôs what it meant by ‚Äòluminous peach‚Äô - for that reason I returned it. Formula is nice though

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I am surprised at how many 5 star reviews this line has! I honestly had really high hopes. Based on the branding, clean ingredients, and price points‚Ä¶maybe my expectations were just too high who knows. All I can say is, for what it is‚Ä¶it‚Äôs just way too expensive! There is hardly any product in these tubes, despite being way too big to bring in a small purse. I say go with Milk Makeup or Merit for similar stick products with clean ingredients, that won‚Äôt break the bank.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have three of these blush sticks in Petal, DouDou and Chouchette.  I love them all.  Chouchette is my favorite and gives you the perfect natural flush.   Beautiful packaging.  Perfect for on the go touch ups.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: It doesn‚Äôt last very long at all. Colour is okay. Price is high for something that only stays on for a couple of hours. I would not repurchase.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: My color is petal. It‚Äôs very lightweight, buildable, long lasting. looks natural easy to apply. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a cream blush. The packaging is really great as well. I had this in my basket for a while, they did not have it in store to try so I finally got it. I wish I got it sooner. It‚Äôs great!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: First off, this packaging is AMAZING!! So compact with a strong magnetic closure. Love it. The product went on smoothly and blended out nicely. But beware my friends... the Minette Luminous Peach means GLITTER not sheen. The pics don't show it, but there is quite a bit of glitter in this color. Maybe another color would be 5 stars, but this one just wasn't it.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I love these blushes! So much so that I have the entire colour range.   I would say that these shades are flattering on almost any skin tone, what it really comes down to is what colour you gravitate to more.   The colour payoff is beautiful, you can buff them out to a more sheer colour or build them for a bolder look.

reviews.review_title: Nothing special, not worth the price.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got the shade Minette. I don't see anything special, prefer tower 28 or Patrick ta. This didn't look different than any other powder blush.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Goes on smoothly, easily to blend and has sticking power, I felt the color was slightly darker and more brown toned than picture on web hence 4 stars rather than 5.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Rich skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Love these and the color payoff. It‚Äôs so easy to apply and gives a perfect coverage.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: Such a pretty color and super easy to blend! It's actually really easy to blend too much with a brush. Simple taps with the fingers is just fine. Packaging is beautiful and I love the product. I'm looking to buy the other colors now!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I'm not that into peach blush, but something about the look of Minette made the peach color look appealing. I have a neutral leaning cool undertone with light skin. This particular color looks so cute on me. I usually cannot pull off peach blush, but this has enough pink in it that it looks super cute and subtle on me. It's pretty creamy, but I don't apply this directly to my cheeks. I take a brush and use it to pull some product from the stick, and then apply by stippling it on. I then blend with powder and it sets nicely. The longevity of this blush in this color is very good. It wore all day on top of foundation for 8-9 hours and it didn't fade. So, even though this is a pricier blush, it's actually very good. I definitely recommend this color!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is the best cream blush I have ever found. It is so perfect- I wouldn't change a thing about it. It's super-pigmented, so a little goes a long way. It's so easy to blend out with fingers or a brush. The finish on the skin is just unreal- it really gives you that flush that looks believable and natural. It's expensive, but honestly it lasts forever. I have the colors Petal and now Poppet. I am in love with both, but Poppet is such a stunning color. I was nervous it might be too bright for my light complexion, but it's so stunning. It's the perfect color for summer! This whole line knocks it out of the park, but the blush is in my top 3 for sure. Highly recommend.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I have been looking for a cream blush that was my color and yet soft and easy to put on.  After ordering almost all known to man I have finally found the one!  This blush is easy to apply and looks so natural.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am so glad I picked up this Westminster Atelier cream blush in Petal. It is the EASIEST cream blush product I have ever used. It looks so gorgeous, natural, so simple to apply and blend with fingers or a brush. This color is perfect my fair skintone. I would definitely recommend this and repurchase in this and other shades. Also, the packaging is beautiful and the magnetic top is clever and fun. One of my favorite beauty products right now.

reviews.review_title: Best Product in the Whole Line
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: If you were to get one product from the whole line I would recommend the blushes. I think they are far superior than any other Westman Atelier products. The shades are beautiful with natural finish and are very long lasting. Also easy to apply with brush or fingers.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, gray hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Beautiful cream product that does a superb job creating a glow-from-within kind of blush.  My favorite blushes previous were YSL A-blush (30 peach on apples of my cheeks and 32 brown on/under my cheekbones and either for my lips), and Surratt blushes (chaleur on apples, la vie en rose on cheekbones) and I‚Äôm surprised to say this will probably join my arsenal. It‚Äôs easier than either the aforementioned blushes to make look natural, and Petal is a perfect color.  I may try Chouchette or Minette on the apples to bring some dimension. It definitely doesn‚Äôt last as long as my usual faves but I kinda don‚Äôt care. It‚Äôs beautiful. One downside is the heavy packaging but I‚Äôll deal.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After being on the hunt for new everyday makeup, I‚Äôm glad I took the gamble on this product. I‚Äôm in my early 30s and noticed that certain products weren‚Äôt doing it for me like they used to, one being powder blush. I was looking for something that would make my skin glowy without resorting to shimmer which would emphasize my pores. Enter Westman Atelier Baby Cheeks blush stick, I am impressed. Initially I was skeptical because of the price but with the recent sale going and Sephora‚Äôs return policy I thought, what have I got to lose. It gives me exactly what I was looking for, a hint of color without looking like straight up makeup but still enhancing the cheeks. I popped some on my lips as well, you get two products in one! I would recommend for anyone searching for a ‚Äúyouthful glow from within‚Äù look. For reference, I currently wear Nars Pure Radiant tinted moisturizer in the color ‚ÄúFinland‚Äù and this color was the perfect rosy ‚Äúpetal‚Äù color.

reviews.review_title: Gorgeous color and texture but doesn‚Äôt stay on
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: While I loved the color and application of this, it lasted maybe 2 hours. Really wanted this one to work out bc I love this brand and the approach to makeup - especially for women over 40.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I bought both couchette and petal. I love them both! Chou cherry gives you a sun kissed glow and Petal is a nice pop of pink that isn‚Äôt ‚Äúfake.‚Äù They go on smooth and last under my mask in the operating room all day (13 hours). My only complaint is the amount of product for the price, but if you have the money to splurge then this is a great choice!

reviews.review_title: A little goes a long way!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: A little goes a long way with this. I prefer to apply this with a wet sponge after dabbing direct from the tube and lightly removing the excess on my hand. I own both Petal and Poppy and Petal is a much more useable color. Poppy is intense and you should use the smallest amount. They say you can put it on your lips but I tried that and...I prefer lipstick.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Knocking of one star for price. I got this as a blister sample and love cream blushes. I was in the market for one and although the price of this deterred me at first, I kept using the sample and knew I couldn‚Äôt go back. Petal seems to be a neutral deep rose, good for most people. The formula is so creamy and easy to blend and it stays! The magnetic cap is luxurious but I have the contour and they repel each other and it takes away from the luxurious ness.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Beautiful shade, that perfect rosy flush, and an extremely spreadable formula. I pick up a tiny amount on my Artis oval 7 brush and my cheeks look watercolor painted with the healthy, sheer color. Packing is luxe and tube is travel-friendly, too!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I think this is the best cream blush I now own; blends beautifully and doesn't settle into my pores or foundation. Since I never finish a blush anyway the amount of product is of no concern. As I get older, I would much rather have something that feels luxe. The color is a little cool for NC25 me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This blends out so incredibly beautifully. Applies a sheer wash of color that looks very natural and is buildable for a stronger look.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I just got this in the mail and while the color is beautiful in person, there is hardly any product in this chunky stock. Misleading for sure. While I‚Äôm sure the color applied is still beautiful and would last a while, I‚Äôm returning for the price/product amount.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: The hype is true! The color is beautiful with the most amazing payoff. It melts right into the skin and looks gorgeous. I did not feel the need to reapply during the day either which is phenomenal. I just wish there was more product. The size of the packaging made me believe that there was a ton of product but only to find less than half of the size of the packaging. For $48, the hefty price should yield more product than this. But I do understand there's a lot more that we are paying for like quality ingredients and packaging.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Love this!! Has helped speed up my makeup time in the morning and is the perfect everyday color for me (semi fair skin and light brown hair, hazel eyes). Also is creaming and has a nice finish - just use my fingers to blend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This blush is everything... it gives me the ‚ÄúI was just in the sun‚Äù flushed look that I love. The formula is clean and blends beautifully. It is effortless, and well worth the splurge in my opinion. The packaging is luxe and I feel special when I use it. Definitely recommend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love this product it‚Äôs very pigmented but easy to blend. I have dry skin and this helps make my skin look healthier.

reviews.review_title: Love the intelligent design of the product itself!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Love the magnetic top and the color nude peach works well with my skin tone.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I was so sure I'd end up returning this, especially because the price is so steep (I got it during the last sale) but I LOVE it and it's become my daily go to. The color is beautiful, the finish has such a nice glow and it lasts pretty long. The size is nice as well as it's a little smaller than your normal stick blush and makes application easier. Also, the packaging is so beautiful and luxe! I'm already planning to purchase another color! Wish they carried it in store as I'd love to see the other products in this line, but the prices are a bit high to order just to try.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wow, this is a great product. I‚Äôve been using a few other products by Westman Atelier and have always wanted to try the blush. So glad I did, it might even be my favorite product of theirs.   I‚Äôm always trying to make my face look...not dead on Zoom. But hate wearing foundation or really much of anything. But just a bit of this blush, and my skin comes alive. I was nervous the Petal color would be not noticeable on me (some other reviewers have said the color is really subtle). But I think it actually packs quite a bit of punch on my medium golden skin tone. I have to use very little to turn from zombie into human.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I love the product it looks so natural yet beautiful, and the application is effortless

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This blush is amazing! The color is a shimmery peach that acts as a highlighter and blush, giving the perfect amount of glow, while still looking natural. Its long lasting and the consistency is very blendable. Will definitely order more when more colors are back in stock

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Gorgeous color on my skin tone. So smooth in application. Feels hydrating but is not greasy. WA is for a more soft, natural look, Not a ‚Äúmakeupy‚Äù look. Doesn‚Äôt last until the end of the day and have to reapply sometimes but I always have to, no matter what blush. All of AW packaging is top notch and gorgeous.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Omg I don‚Äôt understand the price or hype. No pigment at all. It does have a smoothing effect but not worth 50 bucks!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Was just ok. I expected it to be much better looking at the hype behind it. I prefer nudestix to this anytime. The color was super light, the glitter was a lot and the worst part was the smell. I actually love some smells on cosmetics. Makes it feel expensive and nice but this was overwhelming. Definitely not for me. Thinking of getting another color which might not hv glitter but am super reluctant due to the smell.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: The best. So easy to apply and blend. I use it for my day to day make up routine!

reviews.review_title: Why glitter?! Ruins a perfectly colored blush
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, red hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Why is it that all of the most beautiful, perfect peachy blushes all have glitter?!  It ruins it for anyone over 22. Especially this formulation - I thought that at least if the glitter stayed localized to where I applied the blush it would be fine, but I checked back in the mirror 2 hours later and while the color itself stayed put perfectly, the glitter had migrated ALL OVER MY FACE, making me look like a ball of microglitter!  No thanks. This would be a lifelong keep if they removed the glitter, though.

reviews.review_title: Pretty color Applies and Blends easily
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I received a sample card of this. The blush applies and blends very easily with fingertips. I've used it for several days. My skin is dry and sensitive and I have not noticed clogged pores or break outs. I like that this is a clean product. It doesn't take much product to blush your face and neck so the full sized doesn't seem so pricey once I actually used the product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I received a sample of this which made me very excited as I've wanted to try this for some time. It blends onto cheeks like a dream, very easy and pretty color at first. It seems to settle down to a subtler tone and disappears as the day goes on. I think I just expected more.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: These are my favorite blushes of all time!!! They are very easy to use and layer, and can be applied with a brush or even your fingers if you're rushing. Very natural looking blush sticks, I own 3 of them

reviews.review_title: Perfect shade for fair, aging skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This cream blush is like magic. I've learned to stipple it on with a brush for a gorgeous flush that makes my skin look noticeably smooth and lovely. An A+ must have product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Beautiful color and lasts all day. I use on cheeks and lips, the color looked at to bright at first but blended out to a gorgeous shade. Super easy to blend!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, gray hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I‚Äôm very fair with cool undertone, blue eyes, and silver hair. This shade works beautifully for me as a blush and lip color.   Love the formula and brand.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, gray hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I already had this in Petal and thought I‚Äôd give this shade a try. It is described as berry red, but reads as a rust/ brick red on me. Love the formula, but this shade isn‚Äôt flattering on me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I really like this.  It‚Äôs better with the brush!  But the super loaded highlighter has a better consistency and lasts longer so I find myself Using that instead.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: This color is just gorgeous. The product itself is just ok. Goes on great but does not last. Totally gone in under 2 hrs. I like Poppet much better than the shade Petal. Both are an absolute rip off. These products are not even worth $15. I‚Äôm serious. I can‚Äôt wait until YouTube gets wise and starts finding not only dupes for all Gucci Westman‚Äôs products but actually compare them to much better products at a more affordable ...actually, a more REALISTIC PRICE!!!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, auburn hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Not so great. I thought this was going to be the holy grail of blushes. It‚Äôs pretty but does not last more than 2 hours. Absolutely not worth $48.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is a really nice cream blush. The colors are beautiful ,I purchased petal and  the red berry . It‚Äôs nice and creamy but the really great thing about this blush is it‚Äôs so natural looking and the staying power. I like that you can apply a quick swipe of color or get a deeper color payoff .I use ilia cream blush which is a little cheaper but this blush has more product. I love both equally !!

reviews.review_title: Poppet beautiful bright color tan skin
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Beautiful color on tan, deeper skin tones. Love cream blushers. Only reason not giving it 5 stars is that I think you can get just as beautiful cream blush at a cheaper price, and clean, too: Kjaer Weis, Chantecaille. $48 is a lot for cream blusher. Maybe cheaper option even Rare Beauty or Fenty.

reviews.review_title: Buy it!, but only for the packaging
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This did not meet my expectations as there is so much hype around these products. I think the formula is drier than typical cream blushes. I LOVE the nude stix all over dewy color blushes and feel those formulas as well as wear time is superior while also being much cheaper. And the biggest thing I do not like is clay smell. which is really strong. The packaging is what has me keeping this in my collection. That, in and of itself, is stunning.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am in love with this!! Holy smokes. Such a stunning luminous cream blush that applies softly and is buildable and blendable. This is not a cost effective option but I will absolutely repurchase this product when I run out because it leaves just such a light and beautiful flush and gentle shimmer to the skin. I can‚Äôt say enough good things about this because I really love it

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Wow is this beautiful!  Blends easily and wears all day.  Even on my combo skin.  Will buy this again for sure!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: It‚Äôs a bright color, but it is possible to sheer out and be subtle. I really think it will be a good spring and summer shade !!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got the foundation, blush and contour sticks from this line, and the contour + blush are my faves. They are solid, recommendable products in my opinion. I got Chouchette and although I am new to the cream blusher world, I fell in love with this. It is so easy to use and blends beautifully - just like skin - Its goof proof. Very happy with this purchase. 5 stars!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This cream blush is gorgeous and the staying power is amazing for this type of product. I was afraid the deep berry would be too dark, but it‚Äôs perfect for my light olive skin tone and dark hair. It is expensive, but the payoff is worth it and I think it will last a long time.

reviews.review_title: Pricey for blush but it is nice
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I just started hearing about this brand in the last month or so and I was excited to try it. Honestly, the magnetic closure and the packaging and everything about it is super luxe and really nice, but I don‚Äôt really understand why this blush is $48. I don‚Äôt mind paying that for foundation, for example, but for blush? I don‚Äôt know. I‚Äôm sure it lasts a long time and I love that it‚Äôs clean, but I ended up returning it because I just couldn‚Äôt justify paying that much for blush. I‚Äôm still giving it 5 stars because maybe I‚Äôm just a cheap***. Ha.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I bought petal the review says poppet, I tried to correct that. The color is beautiful and glides on the skin effortlessly, but the impact of color doesn‚Äôt blend well and I had to reapply it to get it back to the original shade. Get a darker shade? Maybe it‚Äôs supposed to be subtle? I had to use a lot and thats not cool for the price point.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I love this blush!  I can see this line becoming an emerging obsession for me.  When I first opened the product I was a bit dismayed by how deep the color is (I'm blonde, green eyed, with light-medium skin).  However, despite the color payoff, it blends beautifully.  I use in on cheeks, eyes (blended with gold/bronze it makes a wonderful base for a rose gold eye) and I LOVE this color on my lips!  I'm sure there are going to be other baby cheeks shades in my future...

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Loving this product!  Goes on creamy and blends in like magic.  Packaging is so lovely-magnetic close is a nice added feature.  The color is really nice and love that it can be worn on lips as well.  So glad I purchased!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I own this in Chouchette and Minette (the 2 lighter shades) and I use both interchangeably. They are multi-use in that they look great on cheeks and a touch to bring color to lips. I have had both for over a year and they are more than 3/4 remaining - I can't imagine ever running out of this! This whole brand/line is just fabulous. Follow the brand and Gucci's personal instagram for ideas on how to use her products. They are just wonderful!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, fairLight skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Wonderful Silky, Glowy Blush! I have Purchased in Dou Dou, Petal & a Holiday Box Shade Mimi..All are Spectacular..I only need a small amount blended with the Westmanatelier blush brush or my fingers & done. For an extra glow add 1 of the peau de shades & the Lit Stick..Remains in place & gets better as the day goes on..Perfect for all & Incredible on Mature Skin..Love that the Line is Clean & Nourishing..Side Note Proper Skin Care 1st..Then Gucci W. Magic is all you Need!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: I saw influencers on Instagram posting about this and was skeptical but curious. The moment I put it on I was sold. Very beautiful blush and color. Gives you that glowing from the inside out look.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Don‚Äôt be afraid of this color. I have bought petal, chouchette, dou dou, minette. These blushes are so blendable (especially good w foundation stick). They not only feel amazing, but they look beautiful on. The oils in them make them more sheer and blendable than Ilia and Milk etc. this blows them out of the water. A must try. The price may be steep, but it is worth it. Texture and quality, beyond.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: A beautiful product all around, as is most of the Westman Atelier line. The packaging is super lux - there‚Äôs a good weight to it and the magnetized cap snaps on with a satisfying click. The blush itself is smooth and pigmented.  On my medium skin tone it‚Äôs very natural and impossible to overdo. Easy to apply with finger or brush, it has good lasting power for a cream product, and the stick format is east to tote around for touch ups. I would totally get more colors if price wasn‚Äôt an issue!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, blonde hair, lightMedium skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: The best makeup I have ever used, hands down from a true beauty product junkie. So so beautiful. The colors, the texture, and the fact that it makes my skin look out of this world... beauty that no one can quite put their finger on. Incredible.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: LOVE IT!! I have petal, Couchette and poppet. All lovely colors!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, blonde hair, mediumTan skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: Poppet is LITERALLY STUNNING! The very best cream blush I‚Äôve ever tried & My collection is vast... poppet in particular is extremely long wearing, blends effortlessly, & is beautiful as a lip stain. I also have Chouchette which is very subtle & nude on my atelier IV skin.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is the best cheek blush stick I have ever used.  Firstly, the product stays on my skin all day, which is hard to find with clean products.  Secondly, it has lasted me so long -which makes it worth the price.  The packaging is beautiful (this goes for all of the products). I would highly recommend to anyone who is looking for a natural look!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This is a great cream blush- it's so pigmented and a little bit goes a long way! I just got it and am super happy. The packaging is weighty, although I wish the cap's magnet was stronger or replaced with a twist.

reviews.review_title: For all the neutral redhead babes.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, red hair, Fair skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: This color might be my perfect cream alternative to Jane Iredale‚Äôs copper wind. I believe the WA website recommended this for lighter skin tones if you want a ‚Äújust been in the sun‚Äù look ‚Äî but I feel like the peach tilt on this is more ‚Äúapres ski‚Äù than a beachy sun look.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Love this! Best cream blush I have used (and I‚Äôve tried them all). Love all of this line but this is definitely my favorite product!

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I just wanted to share I purchase this back in 2018 from her website and the quality of the product is great. For Black women who are afraid to purchase please know the product is skin great on our skin and less is more on the cheeks. I don't recommend using it on our lips but a make no make day yes for cheeks and soft eye shadow. Less is more remember.
